programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: Escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city, James takes the train to visit the rest of England; from ghost tours and hiking in Scotland, to football in Liverpool, to an epic thrill ride in Wales.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his older brother Colton head to Austin, Texas to sample BBQ from a blind pitmaster and live music from a blind musician; ashort road trip to Houston connects them with blind celebrity chef Christine Ha.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his sister Cassie visit Frankfurt and Mainz, enjoying beer and brats, and exploring Germany's infrastructure of support for the visually impaired; this culminates in a tour of the Dialogue Museum.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his sister Cassie travel to Zurich and visit ETH Zurich, the MIT of Europe, where they try out prototypes of new technological solutions for accessibility; they venture to the top of a tall peak in Davos for an evening in an igloo.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: At the dawn of the 20th Century, immigrant entrepreneur Carl Laemmle looks to cash in on America's growing fascination with moving pictures; but as he starts to build an industry, he comes up against a powerful cartel headed by Thomas Edison.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: Edison's stranglehold on the moving picture industry forces Laemmle and his band of renegade filmmakers to flee to Cuba, but not before he signs a promising young actress named Mary Pickford.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: To outdo his rivals, Laemmle builds a massive film factory in Hollywood called Universal City.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: As Hollywood goes from a dusty farm town to a bustling metropolis, the balance of power shifts in favor of the stars; titans like Paramount's Zukor are now forced to pay huge contracts to top actors to keep them happy.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: By 1925, Zukor's Paramount Pictures, Laemmle's Universal Pictures, and Mayer's MGM are some of the most profitable businesses in the country.

programme.title: Titans: The Rise of Hollywood
programme.desc: The Warners' film "The Jazz Singer" proves to the world that "talkies" are here to stay.

programme.desc: A woman (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) discovers the horrifying truth about the outside world while living in an underground shelter with two men (John Goodman, John Gallagher Jr.).

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A spaceship missing for seven years finally re-emerges and sends out a distress signal. But when a team is sent out to investigate, they discover that something sinister has taken over the craft.

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Strange events take place after a family (Ryan Reynolds, Melissa George, Jesse James) moves into a new house that was the site of several gruesome murders.

programme.title: The Last House on the Left
programme.desc: Parents torture the sadists who kidnapped, raped and murdered their daughter (Sandra Cassel) and her friend (Lucy Grantham).

programme.title: The Killing
programme.desc: The organizers of a brilliantly conceived racetrack heist find their perfect crime beginning to unravel.

programme.title: Poltergeist II: The Other Side
programme.desc: An American Indian helps a broke and homeless family (JoBeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson), once again prey to a poltergeist (Julian Beck).

programme.title: The Little Girl Who Lives Down the Lane
programme.desc: A lone 13-year-old (Jodie Foster) resorts to murder to protect her haven from prying adults who wonder where her father is.

programme.title: Children of a Lesser God
programme.desc: Starting his new job as an instructor at a New England school for the deaf, James Leeds meets Sarah Norman, a young deaf woman who works at the school as a member of the custodial staff.

programme.title: Hamburger Hill
programme.desc: An account of the 101st Airborne Division's 10-day struggle to secure a strategic mountainside in South Vietnam.
Sparta's King Leonidas (Gerard Butler) and his badly outnumbered warriors fight to the death against King Xerxes' massive Persian army at the Battle of Thermopylae.

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Green Beret veteran Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) takes on a Pacific Northwest sheriff (Brian Dennehy) and the National Guard.

programme.title: Married to the Mob
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Matthew Modine) gets close to a gangster's widow (Michelle Pfeiffer) in order to nab a crime boss (Dean Stockwell).

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda
programme.desc: An American (Jamie Lee Curtis) flirts with a crook, a barrister (John Cleese) and a mercenary (Kevin Kline) to find diamonds in London.

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers) chases a jewel thief (David Niven) and his nephew (Robert Wagner).

programme.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bungling Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) once again seeks the Pink Panther diamond and maddens his boss (Herbert Lom).

programme.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) is on the trail of his ex-boss (Herbert Lom), who is out to destroy the world.

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda
programme.desc: An American (Jamie Lee Curtis) flirts with a crook, a barrister (John Cleese) and a mercenary (Kevin Kline) to find diamonds in London.

programme.title: Showgirls
programme.desc: A dancer (Elizabeth Berkley) becomes understudy in a Las Vegas show, sleeps with the boss (Kyle MacLachlan) and pushes the star (Gina Gershon) down a flight of stairs.
